alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 02 at 3:32PM AKDT until September 02 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Tanana River from Nenana to Old Minto * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...The Tanana River is bankfull from Nenana to Old Minto with minor flooding occurring or expected in some low lying areas. The lower Nenana River at Nenana is also bankfull and may experience minor flooding. Water levels will remain near minor flood stage through the weekend and areas around Nenana will likely see water going overbank into low lying areas near the river. Additionally, rising groundwater may start to impact crawl spaces or pond in Nenana. Bankfull conditions are expected to persist into early next week. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 326 PM AKDT, Heavy rain that fell over the Alaska Range the past week is causing high water on the Nenana and Tanana Rivers. Additional heavy rain in the Alaska Range Friday night will result in more runoff into the Tanana and Nenana Rivers this weekend, and could cause further rises on the Tanana and Nenana Rivers. - For those recreating or hunting on the Tanana and Nenana Rivers, all gravel bars will be covered with water, debris will be in the river, along with increased erosion. Be cautious of rising water levels if you plan to park your vehicle near the river while out on your boat. - For Tanana River at Nenana: At 3;00 pm Saturday the stage was 11.6 feet. Flood Stage is 12.5 feet. Forecast: The river will fluctuate near flood stage through Monday. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana and Nenana Rivers stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
